Mango is an interactive desktop app for managing tasks, optimized for use via a Command Line Interface (CLI)
while still having the benefits of a Graphical User Interface (GUI).
If you can type fast, Mango can get your task management tasks done faster than
1. Ensure you have Java 11 or above installed in your Computer.
3. Copy mango.jar to the folder you want to use as the home folder for your Mango.
4. Double-click the file to start the app.
5. Type your commands in the chat box e.g. `list`
6. Refer to the **Features** list below for more information on the commands available.
Input the description and tag for the todo you want to create.
Example of usage: `todo read book /tag fun`
Mango prints a confirmation message and the description of the todo added.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task in the list.
Input the description, deadline date in *yyyy-mm-dd* format, and tag for the deadline you want to create.
Example of usage: `deadline return book /by 2019-10-15 /tag tedious`
Mango prints a confirmation message and the description of the deadline added.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Input the description, event date, and tag for the deadline you want to create.
Example of usage: `event birthday /at Monday /tag exciting`
Mango prints a confirmation message and the description of the event added.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Mango prints a list of tasks that match the given keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Input the index of the task to be marked complete.
Mango prints a confirmation message and the description of the completed task.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Input the index of the task you want to delete.
Mango prints a confirmation message and the description of the task deleted.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Mango prints the list of all your tasks.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Mango saves your current task list for next time.
Mango replies with a farewell message.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!

* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Mango's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.

* Represents a task that is a deadline. A Deadline object corresponds to a
* Task that has a description, a completion status, and a date by which the task should be completed.
* @param description The description of the deadline.
* @param date The date on which the deadline falls in yyyy-mm-dd format.
* @param tag The tag attached to this deadline.
public Deadline(String description, String date, String tag) {
* Constructor for a Deadline, initialised with a completion status.
* @param description The description of the deadline.
* @param date The date on which the deadline falls in yyyy-mm-dd format.
* @param status The completion status of the deadline.
* @param tag The tag attached to this deadline.
public Deadline(String description, String date, String status, String tag) {
* Returns the string representation of the type of task.
* @return The string representation of the type of task.
* Returns the description of the deadline.
* Returns the string representation of the deadline for saving.
* @return The string representation of the deadline.
return String.format("%s:%s:%s:%s:%s\n", this.getType(), this.getStatus(), this.description, this.date, this.tag);
* Represents a task that is an event. An Event object corresponds to a
* Task that has a description, a completion status, and a date on which it happens.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param date The date on which the event occurs.
* @param tag The tag attached to the event.
public Event(String description, String date, String tag) {
* Constructor for an Event, initialised with a completion status.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param date The date on which the event occurs.
* @param status The completion status of the event.
* @param tag The tag attached to the event.
public Event(String description, String date, String status, String tag) {
* Returns the string representation of the type of task.
* @return The string representation of the type of task.
* Returns the description of the event.
* Returns the string representation of the event for saving.
* @return The string representation of the event.
return String.format("%s:%s:%s:%s:%s\n", this.getType(), this.getStatus(), this.description, this.date, this.tag);
* Represents a task. A Task object has a description and a completion status.
* Constructor of a Task, initialised with a completion status and a tag.
* @param description The description of a task.
* @param tag The tag relevant to the task.
* @param isDone The completion status of the task.
public Task(String description, String tag, boolean isDone) {
* Retrieves the tag of the task.
* @return The tag attached to the task.
* Returns the completion status of the task.
* @return True if the task is done, else false.
* Returns the string representation of the completion status of the task.
* @return The string representation of the completion status of the task.
* Returns the string representation of the task for saving.
* @return The string representation of the task.
return String.format("%s:%s:%s::%s\n", this.getType(), this.getStatus(), this.description, this.tag);
* Returns the string icon of the completion status of the task.
* @return The string icon of the completion status of the task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X

* Task that has a description and a completion status.
